title: A World Without Fossil Fuels Is Approaching. But You Might Not Live Long Enough to See It.
text:
Will the world ever be free of fossil fuels? That’s been a topic of much discussion in the runup to Climate Week, a United Nations-sponsored event that begins on Monday.

Renewable energy, such as solar and wind power, is now a bigger generator of U.S. electricity than coal, despite pushback against renewables from the Trump administration, which last week said it would end California’s ability to limit vehicle emissions. description: Still, plenty of people—and companies—will be reducing their carbon footprints, creating investment opportunities.
